conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_B. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to join your community. If admitted, I will accept immediately and withdraw other applications. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice first. School_B ranks me 3rd in its priority list, so I have a credible chance if higher-priority students choose other schools. Since capacities are 1, securing School_B early is best; if rejected, I can pivot to School_D next round.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. At this time, we are not able to offer you admission. We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is D > A > B > C > E. In this round I received applications from Student_B and Student_A. Student_A is ranked higher than Student_B on my priority list, so accepting Student_B now would block me from matching with a more-preferred candidate when my quota is only 1. Also, Student_A ranks School_B 4th, so they may not ultimately commit if they get higher choices, but under these rules an [ACCEPT] forms an immediate match, so I should not accept a lower-ranked student preemptively. Therefore I reject Student_B to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates (especially Student_A now, and potentially Student_D later).

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_B is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the chance to join your community. I believe I would contribute strongly and be a reliable, engaged student. I would like to formally apply for your available seat and would happily commit if accepted.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but I am only 3rd in School_A's priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D), so acceptance is uncertain. In contrast, at School_B I am 2nd in their priority list, giving me a strong chance to secure a match quickly. Since early matching removes me from the market and guarantees a good outcome, I will apply to School_B now to lock in a high-probability placement rather than risk rejection at School_A and lose time/position elsewhere.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for your thoughtful note. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Please confirm your commitment and we will proceed with enrollment steps. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is D > A > B > C > E with quota 1. In this round I have applications from Student_A and Student_B. Student_A is ranked higher than Student_B on my list, and I already rejected Student_B earlier. While Student_D is my top choice, they have School_B as their 3rd choice and are likely to apply first to School_C or School_A; there is no guarantee they will come, and holding the seat risks ending unmatched. Accepting Student_A now secures a high-priority match (2nd on my list) within quota and is preferable to waiting for an uncertain higher-ranked applicant.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m formally applying. School_C is my #1 choice because I value your academic environment and would commit enthusiastically if admitted. I’m ready to accept immediately if offered the seat. Thank you for your consideration.

I will signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if possible.

With quota 1, accepting Student_E now would foreclose the chance to take Student_D (a higher-priority candidate) who is already applying and also ranks School_C as #1, so there is no advantage in taking E over D. Therefore I should reject Student_E to preserve the seat for a higher-priority match.
